## Cost of Debt: YTM and After-Tax Adjustment A bond with face value \$1000, **coupon rate = 7.5**% (annual), **price = \$912**, and **maturity = 4** years. Compute the **approximate YTM**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ **Idea:** The YTM is the bondholder’s **required return** if coupons are reinvested at the same rate. A handy approximation is: YTM ≈ (Coupon + (FV − Price)/n) ÷ ((FV + Price)/2). **Your numbers:** ≈ (75 + (1000 − 912)/4) ÷ ((1000 + 912)/2) = **10.15%**.
::: If the **corporate tax rate** is **21**%, compute the **after-tax cost of debt**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ **Why lower after tax?** Interest is tax-deductible, so the effective cost is **Rd × (1 − T)**. **Your numbers:** 10.15% × (1 − 21%) = **8.02%**.
:::
